intro: Fagraea rarissima, commonly known as the rarest fagraea species, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes various tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its striking, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its bark is rough and fissured. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Fagraea rarissima is considered a rare and endangered species.
